We performed a random search combined with fivefold cross-validation to determine the optimal parameters for SVC, KNN and RF methods. Random hyperparameter search randomly selects values from predefined ranges or distributions to evaluate model performance. This is typi-cally done using techniques such as k-fold cross-validation, where the training set is further divided into k-folds, and the model is trained and evaluated on different subsets of data, with each fold used as the validation set once. Then the model is trained and tested multiple times with different hyperparameter values to obtain an estimate of its performance. 27 28 Overview of the natural language processing pipeline.
